lexUnit.name: collar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band of material around the neck of a shirt or other garment, either upright or turned over.

sentence.text: Nana was small and scrawny , and the sinews in her neck stood out like guy-ropes above the demure white collar of her dark blue dress .
The striped tie was neat beneath the collar of a white blouse .
The crimson rivulets were lengthening , tracing lines down his throat and soaking into the collar of his overalls .
He slipped off his jacket , threw it to the other end of the couch , loosened his tie , unbuttoned his collar .
As soon as he 'd given it , the ragged man sidled out , trying to hide behind his shapeless collar .
She unhooked her cloak collar as we had to wait at the outer door of Marcus whilst two porters wheeled out an empty accident trolley .
He had on a three-quarter-length crombie with a velvet collar , a dark-blue suit with the faintest of pin-stripes and a snowy linen shirt .
` I want something to eat , " she protested , clasping her coat collar round her slim neck .
An expensive-looking man in a black coat with a velvet collar was appraising a painting .
She was wearing a fur hood and a Melton cloth coat with a huge fur collar .
` Hello , Hank , " they said in chorus from the depths of the fur collars of their coats .
Miss Barrett entered the flat in a strawberry-red coat with a white fur collar , a yellow wool hat and brown fur gloves without fingers .
In her blue dress with the big , lace collar , she must have looked as strange to the other customers as they did to her .
Paul stood watching the carriage bearing his love away , oblivious of the wet snow trickling down his neck beneath his coat collar .
The winter sun came out over the signals aerials on the top of the regimental headquarters and I warmed my neck , rubbing it against the collar of my knitted undershirt .
The neck of her gown was a collar of spun gold , and the front was open , court style , to the level of her breast .
Johnny grabbed him by the shirt collar .
He fastened his shirt collar with the stud and adjusted his tie , it was almost supper time and Mrs Marsh liked her guests to be punctual .
Tabitha Jute pulled up the collar of her old foil jacket and strode off past the concession stalls , looking for transport .
Nellie pulled up the collar of her coat against the wind .
Outside the hotel Maggie turned up the collar of her mac .
Peter turned up the collar of his coat .
He wore pince-nez spectacles , a round-ended stiff collar , and a moustache .
The child had worn a purple suit with a lace collar .
I tried to run past him but he grabbed the collar of my coat .
His head has sunk into the upturned collar of his black wool coat .
I noticed that the women with the scraggy necks were all sweating ; so were the men in the red ties with the tight collars on their shirts .
The singer loosened the collar of his shirt and let his voice flow out as turbulently and tranquilly as he desired .
There was a smear of yellow greasepaint on the collar of his shirt .
He was tall and badly shaven , his raincoat collar turned up against the cold of the December night .
